timeout1:
Dear {uploader},

Thanks again for uploading data for {site_id} on {date} (see complete file list below).

According to our records, we have not received replacement uploads for one or more of the files below that failed Format QA/QC.

Format QA/QC results:
{format_results}

You can re-upload your data at https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/data/upload-data/ and/or reply to this email to discuss with us.

View the status of all your uploaded files at https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/qaqc-reports-data-team/. 

You can track communications on this Format QA/QC report at {jira_ticket_link} using your AmeriFlux account ID and password to login.

Sincerely,
AMP Data Team
internal_timeout_support: This issue had an unexpected Reminder label given its current status, time since status change {days_since_status_change}, and existing labels {existing_labels}. Please check it out.
internal_timeout: This issue has timed out. No action by site team in {time_out_length} days.

data_qaqc_report_email.salutation:
Dear {r}{p},

Thank you for your data submissions for {s} ({n}).

self_review.intro: The summary statistics and figures, generated by the AmeriFlux Data QA/QC pipeline, are ready for your teamâ€™s review.
self_review.qaqc_results:
*[Data QA/QC]*
Please review the summary statistics for each check below following the instructions [here|{instructions_link}].

* [Timestep Alignment|{ftp}/summary/timeshift_summary.csv]
* [Percent-Ratio|{ftp}/summary/thresholds_ratio_summary.csv]
* [Physical Range|{ftp}/summary/thresholds_limit_summary.csv]
* [Multivariate Comparison|{ftp}/summary/multivariate_intercomparison_summary.csv]
* [Diurnal-Seasonal Pattern|{ftp}/summary/diurnal_seasonal_summary.csv]
* [USTAR Filtering|{ftp}/summary/ustar_filter_summary.csv]

Additionally, review the [variable coverage figure|{ftp}/variable_coverage/{site_id}-Variable_Coverage-by_Year.png] for variable naming and data coverages for the full data record.
self_review.instructions:
Please note that certain QA/QC checks may not run if the target variable(s) or required info are absent.

*Please review and correct any identified issues.* To resubmit a corrected version, please upload files using {ui}data/upload-data/.

*If you feel the data are ready for publication as AmeriFlux BASE, please confirm by replying to this email.* Provide brief clarification for any issues detected (FAIL or WARNING in the summary statistics) that are acceptable for your site.

Reply to this email with any questions or clarification. You can track communications on this Data QA/QC at {i} using your AmeriFlux account ID and password to login.

You can view the AmeriFlux QA/QC processing status for all your sites at {ui}sites/data-processing-status/ (login required).
self_review.closer:
Best regards and thanks for the collaboration,
AmeriFlux Data Team

-----------------------------------------
*The full output directory with summary statistic files and figures is at*
{ftp}.

amp_review.intro: This report summarizes the results of AmeriFlux Data QA/QC, which provides an independent analysis of your data and helps identify potential issues in data formats and contents.
amp_review.additional_info: In analyzing your data, we have the following questions where we request your expert opinion and suggestion. Please note that some issues we identify could be normal and expected at your site. Please verify, clarify, or correct the following issues before we can make your data available as an AmeriFlux BASE data product. To resubmit a corrected version, please upload files using {ui}data/upload-data/.
amp_review.instructions:
We hope that this will not take too much time from your work, but it will help to make your data more robust and clear. You can view the AmeriFlux QA/QC processing status for all your sites at {ui}sites/data-processing-status/ (login required).

Please reply to this email with any questions. You can track communications on this Data QA/QC at {i} using your AmeriFlux account ID and password to login.
amp_review.closer:
Best regards and thanks for the collaboration,
AmeriFlux Data Team

-----------------------------------------
*FTP link to Data QA/QC, where you can access all figures and intermediate files generated during Data QA/QC:*
{ftp}

data_qaqc_report_email.data_qaqc_desc: Briefly, Data QA/QC includes the inspection of sign conventions, ranges, diurnal-seasonal patterns, and potential outliers of variables. Multivariate relations (e.g., WS vs USTAR, PPFD_IN vs SW_IN) are also analyzed to detect potentially erroneous data. The comparison of measured radiation (e.g., PPFD_IN, SW_IN) to the maximum, top of the atmosphere radiation expected for a given location (i.e., SW_IN_POT) is also analyzed to check the timestamp specification and alignment. Details of each Data QA/QC test module can be found [here|{ui}data/data-processing-pipelines/data-qaqc/].
data_qaqc_report_email.format_qaqc_resources:
*Format QA/QC reports associated with this Data QA/QC, where you can glance at the file sources used in this Data QA/QC:*
{f}
